intro: Sulcolluma mirbatensis, commonly known as the Mirbat spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its upright stem and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
